word_mean: 电磁铁，电磁体：一种暂时性磁铁，由电流通过围绕一个软铁芯的线圈构成

sentence.Network_en: To make an electromagnet you need to send a current through the wire.
sentence.Network_cn: 为了做成电磁体你需要对金属线送电.

sentence.Network_en: The principle of electromagnet induction had thus been discovered.
sentence.Network_cn: 电磁感应定律就是这样发现的.

sentence.Network_en: In the same year Argao made the first electromagnet.
sentence.Network_cn: 同年安高制造了第一个电磁体.

entry.def: An electromagnet is a magnet that consists of a piece of iron or steel surrounded by a coil. The metal becomes magnetic when an electric current is passed through the coil.

means.word_mean: 1. a temporary magnet made by coiling wire around an iron core; when current flows in the coil the iron becomes a magnet

auth_sentence.content: When the electromagnetic field is established the electromagnet begins attracting iron.
